definition: to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist

sentences.english: Then a finger pulp is used to massage by drawing circles on the black spots.
sentences.chinese: 然後用指腹在黑斑部分打圈搓揉。

sentences.english: Sooner orlater persisted the foot heart, promotes the blood circulation.
sentences.chinese: 早晚堅持搓揉腳心，以促進血液循環。

sentences.english: Rub your hands together until they are warm.
sentences.chinese: 互相搓揉您的雙手，直到它們發熱爲止。

sentences.english: Bizot made us explore the forest with the newspaper kneading.
sentences.chinese: 比佐通過搓揉報紙，帶我們體驗了一次密林探險。

sentences.english: Knead the mixture on a lightly floured board until smooth and elastic.
sentences.chinese: 在砧板上搓揉攪勻的麪粉，直到變得軟且有彈性。

sentences.english: Roll your dough on parchment paper, add toppings and lift it all onto the tile.
sentences.chinese: 在牛皮紙上搓揉生面並加上配料。

sentences.english: His breathing slowed and he kneaded his hands.
sentences.chinese: 他的呼吸變緩，兩隻手互相搓揉着。

sentences.english: Jaffe found that when rubbed plants give off increased amounts of ethylene.
sentences.chinese: 賈菲發現，當搓揉植株時，植物放出的。

sentences.english: Fold in sifted flours and baking powder, use hand to knead and forms dough.
sentences.chinese: 將篩過得麪粉和發粉加入，用手搓揉成麪糰。

definition: to rub or roll between the hands or fingers/to twist
to pat/to slap/(of a bird) to flap (one's wings)
to moisten/to dampen/to be steeped in/to be imbued with
